meanings.definition: Pledging as security without delivery of title or possession.
meanings.sent1: The hypothecating of the valuable jewelry ensured the loan was secure.
meanings.sent2: The bank required hypothecating of the car before approving the loan.
meanings.sent3: The hypothecating of the rare painting made the art collector nervous.
meanings.sent4: Her act of hypothecating the antique vase was like putting a lock on her savings.
meanings.sent5: The concept of hypothecating can be compared to keeping a valuable item in a safe deposit box.

meanings.sent1: He was hypothecating his car to get the money for the business.
meanings.sent2: She was hypothecating her house to secure the loan for her education.
meanings.sent3: The idea of hypothecating his favorite guitar for money seemed strange to him.
meanings.sent4: Hypothecating his savings felt like locking them away for a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The act of hypothecating is like promising your valuable item as a guarantee for a loan.
